alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Western Franklin; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hampshire, southern Franklin and northwestern Hampden Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 723 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hadley, or near Northampton. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and street flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Urban and poor drainage flooding is also possible. Locations impacted include... Chicopee, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Northampton, Deerfield, Ludlow, South Hadley, Easthampton, Belchertown, Wilbraham, Palmer, Granby, Southampton, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Williamsburg, Huntington, and Conway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
